title: Prosecuting Burning of the American Flag
summary: Executive Order 14341, issued on August 25, 2025, aims to prosecute the burning of the American flag, which is described as a sacred symbol of the United States. The order highlights that flag burning is seen as an act of contempt, hostility, and violence against the nation. It directs the Attorney General to enforce criminal and civil laws against flag desecration that incite violence or violate applicable laws. The order also authorizes the denial or revocation of visas, residence permits, and other immigration benefits for foreign nationals involved in flag desecration. The order emphasizes the importance of restoring respect for the American flag and outlines measures to combat its desecration while adhering to constitutional and legal constraints.
